page.title: 01YOULGRAVE (YOULGREAVE)
page.content: An historic lead mining village situated in the{Peak District National {Park.}Known locally as "Pommy". Sheffield - 19 miles; Derby - 26 miles; Buxton - l3 miles; Nottingham - 30 miles; London - 152 miles. {Population}- l,400 approximately. {Early closing day}- Wednesday. {Places of worship} - Parish church (12th. century), Methodist chapel, Wesleyan Reform chapel. {School}_ Primary school (108 pupils). {Local industries}- Farming, tourism, silversmiths, limestone quarrying, refractory, hosiery factory. {Market}- Bakewell (3 miles, market day - Monday). {Bus services}- Hourly services to Bakewell, Matlock and Chesterfield. {Railway stations}- Matlock, Buxton. {Historic Houses}- Haddon Hall (3 miles), Chatsworth House (6 miles).
